page.title: 18CELEBRATIONS IN COVENTRY SW.
page.content: Coventry was heavily bombed during {World War}2.The car factories were turned over to the making of aeroplanes and ammunition.Coventry was a prime target for the German bombers.In May 1985 we celebrated the 40th anniversary of{Victory in Europe. In Ashington Grove,Whitley,one lady who still lives there,recalled how all the residents saved something from their rations for a street party.Their joy was mixed with sadness.In one air raid alone 8 people in our Grove were killed.Despite the hardship,the lady felt that nothing compared with the community spirit of wartime. During 1985 Coventry has been celebrating the{100th anniversary of {the motor car}with displays and parades.Only{Talbot Cars}carry on the great tradition of car making in this area.
